title: Witness who filmed fuel tanker fire watches in amazement as blaze grows into monstrous ball
text:
A motorist in Kansas City, Missouri pulled over to the side of an interstate and captured cell phone video showing a fuel tanker fire grow to monster proportions last week.

The video which emerged on Friday shows a fuel tanker engulfed by flames on I-49.

The fire was caused by a three-car accident at around 3:45pm last Friday, according to local media reports.

Police said a motorist driving a Ford Focus was heading southbound 'erratically' and struck the rear of the fuel tanker, which was carrying diesel fuel.

The fuel tanker burned for an hour as firefighters had trouble getting the massive fireball under control. The highway in both directions was closed for hours.

A fuel tanker caught fire on I-49 in Kansas City, Missouri. Amateur video was loaded to the internet on Friday

The fire initially was small, but the danger of a larger blaze was apparent to witnesses nearby

Gradually, the fire began to grow as it ate through the fuel tanker

Firefighters who were called to the scene tried to douse the flames, but were unsuccessful

Several lanes of the intersection were badly damaged as a result of the fire, according to police.

‘This might be a problem,’ says the motorist as he captures the scene on amateur cell phone video.

‘I can’t believe the highway hasn’t shut down yet. Holy crap.’

The motorist was right, as the fire kept growing bigger and more menacing.

‘If this thing blows, I’m gonna feel the heat back here for sure,’ the eyewitness, who is standing a few hundred feet away, says.

‘We’re all trying to watch it, but that trigger might explode and I might be too close.’

Moments later, firefighters arrive on the scene and try to douse the flames, but to no avail.

‘Water’s not gonna do it,’ the narrating witness says.

As time went on, the fire began to grow significantly, generating smoke that could be visible for miles

Witnesses who stood a few hundred feet from the blaze said they could feel the intensity of the heat

As the fire kept growing, one eyewitness wondered: ‘I don’t know what is inside there and why it’s not blowing up.’

What was once a small-scale fire started ballooning to an ever-growing ball of flames that are often seen in Hollywood action movies.

‘Oh, dude!’ the witness yells. ‘It’s hot from where I’m at!’

As the fire grows even larger, the witness yells: ‘Oh my god! Ho-ly crap!’

Another witness nearby asks: ‘Why don’t they put it out?’

The narrator replies: ‘I don’t know. [The fire is] too hot, too fast.’

He then says: ‘Yeah, this thing is no joke!’

As the fire kept growing, the eyewitness wondered: ‘I don’t know what is inside there and why it’s not blowing up.’

Moments later, however, he would be proven correct.

Eventually, the fire grew to mammoth proportions, prompting fire officials to evacuate witnesses nearby

‘I can feel it from here! I can feel the heat big time from here!’ an eyewitness says

It took emergency crews an hour to get the fire under control. A massive fireball is seen above

Authorities said that the fire was caused by a driver in a Ford Focus who struck the back of the fuel tanker

‘This is way more intense than I thought!’ he said.

‘Oh my god, I can feel it from here. It’s burning me from here!

‘I can feel it from here! I can feel the heat big time from here!’

At this point, as the fire grows catastrophically large, emergency personnel on site tell the eyewitnesses on the side of the road to move away.

‘They’re telling us to clear out,’ he says.

The eyewitness says that his car is in danger of being engulfed by the flames, though the exact location of the vehicle is unclear from watching the video.

‘My car is right there! I can’t get close to it! Holy crap!’ he said.

‘I might lose my car.’

With the fire growing ever more dangerous, a firefighter approaches the witnesses and orders them to move away.

‘That’s my car right there. What am I doing?’ the eyewitness said.

‘Get out of here! That’s what’s your doing!’ the firefighter tells him.
description: Video shows a fuel tanker engulfed by flames on I-49 in Kansas City, Missouri. 'If this thing blows, I'm gonna feel the heat back here for sure,' an eyewitness standing a few hundred feet away says.
